ygData.subject: Can anbody help a Newbie?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi! My Boss gave me the instruction to write Process optimizing Programm. First I thougt that it will be hard but possible. By now I have an working alogithm.

Subject: Can anbody help a Newbie?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=224157977
X-Yahoo-Profile: schuller_esa

Hi! 

My Boss gave me the instruction to write Process optimizing Programm.
First I thougt that it will be hard but possible. 
By now I have an working alogithm. Which does the Job quite well. But
now I got some additional rules, so that my Programm produces just
junk.

Were the problem:
I have a number of (lets call them Buckets) 
They are aligned in two rows.
Then I have Two machinetypes. On for Filling and one for emtying the
Buckets.
The material has to go into one Bucket (stay for a while) then from
this into anoter (again Stay) and into a third (stay) and then out.
There are specific Buckets for each phase.

Now I have some rules for the machines.
one cannot go pass the other while it is filling.
for emtying and filling it to another bucket i need two Machines.
The buckets do not have eaquel size, but do always have to be full.
An emtying machine must not leave a Bucket while it is not empty 
....

Some rules differ on each Plant.
The goal is to get as much material through the mashine.

So how do I have to get startet?!
I Tried to think of an algorithm which tries every possible
Combination
(You can go asleep while its working. :-< )

I discoverd NEAT for Delphi and thought that this could be the right
thing. 
But I didn't find any Quickstart or similar to use it. What Functions
do I have to call? And the biggest Question: How should I connect the
Gene? (Which to take for Input and for Output?)

Is there any chance of constant learning? What if it generates an
output against one of of the Rules. How to tell it that it was wrong?

Can anybody point me tho the right direction.
Btw. I use Delphi but I accept Ideas in every language.

Roland Schuller, AUSTRIA
